For several years I've had a disk laying around with a bunch of .PUD files 
on it, but I didn't know exactly what those were so I left them alone. I 
recently obtained a copy of the Warcraft II Battlechest (full basic version 
w/online matchup and expansion levels) and found that .PUDs are 
player-designed Warcraft levels, and those ones on the disk were all based 
on The Hobbit and The Lord Of The Rings by J.R.R. Tolkien. Naturally, I 
tried them out, and some of them kicked ass and some of them sucked. They 
got me thinking: the three games I'm involved in now are Warcraft, 
Gladiator, and The Two Towers (a Tolkien-based Multi-User Dimension, 
http://angband.com/towers), and crossovers between the three would truly 
rock. Why not have Warcraft levels based on the stock Gladiator scenarios, 
or vice versa, or Tolkien-based scenarios with corresponding levels? I threw 
some Greek mythology into the TevFifty, but I'm thinking here of complete 
immersion in the story. Gladiator has several advantages in this department: 
you can include the story blurb, which can be very cool; you can name 
characters; you can see who the enemy is and go kill him, rather than having 
to sit there whacking farms and such. With Warcraft, you have better 
graphics and the ability to wage war at sea and in the sky, but you can only 
use the preprogrammed character names, and if you want a storyline you have 
to put it in a separate text file. The magic and the maps are about equal. 
Anyone have any ideas in this vein? Over the semester break I should have 
enough time to actually execute some of this stuff in the Tevildo style, and 
also do that fanfic stuff I was talking about earlier with attached 
scenarios. I hope there are other people out there doing their own thing, 
and it's not just DPH and I creating. Ricky Derr, got any levels for us? 
Shayd? Anyone? Oh, man... how cool would it be to just insert the code for 
dragons and death knights into Gladiator... (salivating) That's all for now. 
Good luck and regards,
   -Tevildo.
